page.title: 04Libraries in Syston.
page.content: {SYSTON LIBRARY The present library was built in 1962. It was previously situated in the Chapel Hall, Chapel Street. The rooms include: children's library, display area, main library, work room. The library has three vans which are used to take a selection of books to the surrounding villages three times a week. There are 4000 members who are entitled to keep 4 books for 4 weeks. {LIBRARY USE BY CHILDREN.}There are 284 children at Merton Primary School, Syston aged between 5 and 11 years. 158 of them belong to the library. { {SCHOOL LIBRARY (MERTON PRIMARY)} This library contains both fiction and non-fiction books. The children are encouraged to use these for studies at school and home.
